title: Lima’s Most Charming Hoods: Private Half Day with Local Guide
description: Immerse yourself in Lima's three most popular neighborhoods on a private half-day tour. Let your local guide lead the way as you explore the vibrant Barranco, admire stunning ocean views of Miraflores, and wander through the historic center of Lima, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along the way, visit some of the city's top attractions, such as the Monastery of San Francisco and the Park of Love.
all_descriptions: Immerse yourself in Lima's three most popular neighborhoods on a private half-day tour. Let your local guide lead the way as you explore the vibrant Barranco, admire stunning ocean views of Miraflores, and wander through the historic center of Lima, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along the way, visit some of the city's top attractions, such as the Monastery of San Francisco and the Park of Love.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Centro Historico de Lima, Plaza de Armas, Lima 15001 PeruYour first stop is Plaza San Martin, the second most important in the city. You will walk through the crowded Jirón de la Unión, appreciating the art deco and nouveau styles, and end up in the Main Plaza of Lima, where you will find: The Government Palace, The City Hall, La Casa del Oidor, The Cathedral, The Archbishopric, the old bronze Fountain, Taulichusco´s stone, Pasaje Olaya and Club de la Unión. 
While walking through the city our “Local Friend” will show you the Desamparados Train station and the oldest bar in the city: Cordano Bar. 
You will visit San Francisco Church, to appreciate religious art and the mysterious catacombs (The entry ticket is NOT included), OR instead, our “Local Friend” can help you bargain and do some shopping at the souvenir stores near there OR can accompany you to get some snacks in a local restaurant.Duration: 2 hoursStop At:Barranco, Lima PeruBarranco is the bohemian district of Lima. In here you'll visit the bridge of sighs, the mirador, the old Ermita and the main park. Also, you'll have a nice look of the Pacific Ocean.Duration: 1 hourStop At:Miraflores District, Lima PeruHere you will visit the Love Park and have a sightseeing of the pre-inca ruins of Huaca Pucllana and Kennedy Park.Duration: 45 minutes

What is Travelers’ Choice?
Tripadvisor gives a Travelers’ Choice award to accommodations, attractions and restaurants that consistently earn great reviews from travelers and are ranked within the top 10% of properties on Tripadvisor.

About

Immerse yourself in Lima's three most popular neighborhoods on a private half-day tour. Let your local guide lead the way as you explore the vibrant Barranco, admire stunning ocean views of Miraflores, and wander through the historic center of Lima, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along the way, visit some of the city's top attractions, such as the Monastery of San Francisco and the Park of Love.
Why travelers love this

  • elndz
    Written January 16, 2024
    Our tour guide, Cindy, was excellent. She spoke in both English and Spanish as we had 1 non-English speaker and 1 non-Spanish speaker. We felt very safe with our driver. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Cindy. She always found an easier way for our handicapped people to get to where we were going. Thanks Cindy!
  • DaveAzToMaine
    Written January 15, 2024
    My wife and I recently visited Peru for the holidays with my wife's sister and her husband. We spent time in both Lima and Cusco and we used Peruvian Local Friend to coordinate our entire visit. We had visited Peru back in 2017 and had the good fortune to meet Peruvian Local Friend and we were happy to be able to use their services again. They provided three different tour guides for three different tours that we did with them and all of them - Cindy, Evelyn and Cory - were excellent! So much knowledge and so much information shared! We did a city tour of Lima, Cusco and then Machu Pichu. Everything was great! And not only did they provide the tours for us, they also arranged all of our transportation and transfers. We did not have to worry about a thing! Peruvian Local Friend made our trip easy and informative! It was truly a pleasure to work with them again!!
  • Steven F C
    Written December 23, 2023
    I told Sandra at PLF, we wanted to see select sites we hadn’t seen plus Lima from a local’s perspective. Sandra and our guide Rodrigo delivered a 5 star tour for us. We visited places most tourists don’t see. Rodrigo was an oracle of information about Lima and Peru and their relationship in history and the present. If you want a 5 star tour of Lima, call Sandra at PLF and request Rodrigo to be your guide. After contacting Sandra her responses to my many questions were immediate. She also helped with transportation logistics…a lifesaver for a non Spanish speaking client.
  • Lancashire Lass
    Written November 30, 2023
    We had been on a small group tour of Peru and had a day before our return flight home. I'd booked to be picked up and returned to the airport, and to see Barranco and other areas. The tour was planned to be flexible around us and what we wanted to see.

reviews.title: Great touring experience!
reviews.text: My wife and I recently visited Peru for the holidays with my wife's sister and her husband.  We spent time in both Lima and Cusco and we used Peruvian Local Friend to coordinate our entire visit.  We had visited Peru back in 2017 and had the good fortune to meet Peruvian Local Friend and we were happy to be able to use their services again.  They provided three different tour guides for three different tours that we did with them and all of them - Cindy, Evelyn and Cory - were excellent!  So much knowledge and so much information shared!  We did a city tour of Lima, Cusco and then Machu Pichu.  Everything was great!  And not only did they provide the tours for us, they also arranged all of our transportation and transfers.  We did not have to worry about a thing!  Peruvian Local Friend made our trip easy and informative!  It was truly a pleasure to work with them again!!

reviews.title: 5 STAR TOUR OF LIMA
reviews.text: I told Sandra at PLF, we wanted to see select sites we hadn’t seen plus Lima from a local’s perspective. Sandra and our guide Rodrigo delivered a 5 star tour for us. We visited places most tourists don’t see. Rodrigo was an oracle of information about Lima and Peru and their relationship in history and the present. If you want a 5 star tour of Lima, call Sandra at PLF and request Rodrigo to be your guide. After contacting Sandra her responses to my many questions were immediate. She also helped with transportation logistics…a lifesaver for a non Spanish speaking client.

reviews.title: Great insight to all of Lima, amazing guide Cindy
reviews.text: We had been on a small group tour of Peru and had a day before our return flight home. I'd booked to be picked up and returned to the airport, and to see Barranco and other areas. The tour was planned to be flexible around us and what we wanted to see.Our driver was Cesar, who was an excellent, careful driver. I've no idea how he keeps so calm driving around Lima every day!We met Cindy in Barranco and started our walking tour. She listened to what we wanted to do and advised us to have lunch there - an amazing spot, Restaurant Javier, overlooking the sea and great seafood.  Being our last meal in Peru we were greedy and had lots left but it wasn't too expensive. We explored some more of the area, including a lovely gallery/ craft shop.We then drove above Chirolles to look at the bay of Lima overall and then a wander round the fisherman's area. This was Cindy's home area growing up, and she was evidently proud of it and the friendly people, with no other European tourists in sight.A quick drive past one of the 100 pyramids in Lima with a photo stop (we had no idea they existed from our very limited group tour of the city) then through San Isidro, with a wander through the park.This tour gave us a completely different view from the  tour at the start of our Peru trip - it felt like the previous tour had just been to buildings and hadn't given us any feeling for the entire city.Highly recommend the flexible approach of the company in planning our tour and specifically Cindy in delivering such a great experience.

reviews.title: Lima After Noon + Larco Museum tour
reviews.text: We did the Lima After Noon city tour and added a visit to the Larco Museum.  It was very easy to communicate and adjust the tour to our liking ahead of time.  Our guide, Cindy (with driver Cesar), arrived on time to our hotel to begin the tour.  We didn't follow the exact order of sites listed on the website, but Cindy adjusted the order to give us a better experience by avoiding traffic and busy times at certain locations.  She was very knowledgeable and easy to spend a day with around Lima.  We learned so much about the history of the city.  Cindy also provided us with many good suggesting about other things to do and eat after our time together was over.  I would highly recommend visiting the Larco Museum with a guide like Cindy; she was able to tell us the stories of many of the pieces, where on our own we would have tired out halfway through reading placards.  Whenever we return to Lima, Peruvian Local Friend will certainly be used to tour more in and around town.

reviews.title: made the most of one day in Lima
reviews.text: Absolutely cannot praise this company and guide enough. Extremely convenient, worked with my interests, and allowed me to really see some of the city on an unexpected layover. Highlights were street art in Barranco, ceviche lunch in a local restaurant (really - try chicha), the Larco Museum, and the Ariaga House. And a churro! One of the most fun travel experiences of my life.

reviews.title: Short trip to Lima.
reviews.text: Rodri was an exceptional informed guide. We did two days of exploring Lima. Rodri was able to fulfill all our expectations as a guide. We highly recommend him. His knowledge of local food was fantastic.

reviews.title: Truly a local friend
reviews.text: Our guide Cindy spoke perfect English, was very knowledgeable and accommodating. We enjoyed the tour of Miraflores and Barranco; the local insight  and the historical background  provided by Cindy made this day a memorable experience.

reviews.title: Highly recommend using Peruvian Local Friend to plan a trip to Peru!
reviews.text: Peruvian local friend was a GREAT company to use for our first trip to Peru! They were awesome in helping us create a perfect itinerary spanning both Lima and Cusco. Email responses were always quick and comprehensive. Customer service was top tier. They did a great job of giving us options to explore what would be the best for us. I would highly recommend using them to plan a trip! It made the trip so much smoother having all of our guides and transportation pre arranged. Evelyn in Cusco was a particularity good guide! Thank you!

reviews.title: Make the most out of 5 hours in Lima
reviews.text: With a 12-hour layover in Lima, we decided to take a tour with Peruvian Local Friend. We were met at the airport by our driver and joined our guide in downtown Lima. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the history and architecture of the area and we appreciated his flexibility and ability to alter plans to meet our interests. We spent some time in the beautiful Barranco and Miraflores areas before heading back to the airport. Lima is a very large city and takes a lot of time to drive through. I would not recommend trying to navigate this city on your own. This was a very good value to complete our time in Peru.
